subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael


Its a supply contract bid with my company and the  product name is 
Elogrovinox E Herbal Solution., we can make the supply and share the 
profit together, there is a producer in Turkey, and he sells for $9,000 
per barrel and we will sell to my company for $24,000 per barrel. Just 
let me know if you are in, then I can let you know the process we need 
to take. My company will give you a supply contract agreement for 3yrs, 
but I do not want my company to know that Iâ€™m behind this, but as an 
insider and your silent partner, I will do everything possible for you 
to get the contract. and once the contract is signed, we are good to 
commence your monthly bulk supply which is 85-100 barrels  monthly and 
2000-3000 yearly

Remember that my company may require samples of 2 barrels prior to 
contract for confirmatory test analysis, which we will provide to them, 
but that will be after you get in touch with the Chief Procurement 
officer and also I will introduce you to the producer. What we need to 
do is to sign an MOU binding our profit sharing of 80/20 you keep 80% 
then I keep 20%  If you are ok with the profit sharing and also want us 
to continue, please send me your full name, company name if any and full 
address to enable me draft an MOU that is going to bind our profit 
sharing. I will be waiting to hearing from you

Martin Klonz.

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for reaching out and explaining the supply contract bid with your company. The Herbal Solution product sounds interesting. I'm intrigued by the business opportunity you're presenting, especially since it involves a producer in Turkey.

I understand that there's a profit to be made from selling per barrel to your company. However, I would like to know more about the process we need to take if I decide to join this venture.

You mentioned an MOU binding our profit sharing. Could you please elaborate on what this entails? Also, how does the sample requirement of barrels work?

Looking forward to hearing more about this opportunity.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael

  This business procedure is very glaring and it goes with our company's 
supply contract payment policy which is also going to reflect in the 
contract my company is going to issue to you when you must have 
completed the basic requirement which am going to guide you as your 
insider and your silent partner. The payment policy is 60% T/T prior to 
delivery of your bulk aupply and on delivery you will have 40% balance. 
That will be after the confirmatory analytical result of 2 barrels 
samples which will be tested at our company's laboratory by the 
Technicians but supervised by me as the production manager.

  After we sign MOU, i will draft an introduction letter for you that you 
will be sending to my company via the Chief procurement officer(CPO), 
you will be asked to send the product specification of the raw material. 
Then i will give you the contact of the producer in Turkey who will send 
it to you and he was the one producing for my late supplier for  6 years 
before his demise during the covid-19 . After verification of the 
product spec you will also be asked to supply 2 barrels of the raw 
material which will be sample, its to ascertain a confirmatory test 
result at our company laboratory which will be conducted under my watch. 
After the test, you will be given 3 years contract, 60% upfront payment 
to commence on your monthly bulk supply and the monthly demand is from 
85-200 barrels and finally the payment for the 2 barrels initially 
supplied for sample.

The producer has all the certification to ship to any destination of 
your choice. Like  i said before he ships with his certification but 
with your name and full contact address on the bill of laden and on the 
barrels too so my company knows its coming from you. You will be the one 
to give the producer the receiver's information. He will also give you 
the pictures of the produced raw material in barrels and tracking 
numbers from the forwarders, this is to ascertain the movement of the 
product and the arrival which takes just 3 days to UK. Send your name in 
full, company name if any and contact address for the drafting of MOU.

Martin Klonz.

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a very comprehensive process. I'm curious about the testing procedure at your company's laboratory. Could you tell me more about how it works? 

Also, I understand that the producer in Turkey will be sending the raw material to me. How does this process usually go? Is there any specific method of packaging or shipping that he uses?

I'm also interested in learning more about the contract terms. You mentioned an upfront payment and a monthly demand of barrels - could you provide more details on this?

Lastly, I'd like to clarify that while I'm eager to participate in this venture, I won't be able to share my full name, company name or contact address at this time due to privacy reasons.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello, Michael,

The procedure still remains like i explained to you. The first request 
from my company is the product specification. After that you will be 
asked to supply test barrels which will be for the final test, then 
after the test, you will be paid 60% upfront payment for your monthly 
bulk supply which is 85-200 barrels monthly. You will send to the 
producer your name in full and your contact details for the shipment to 
enable him ship directly to our company which you give him the details 
too. After the the shipment , he will send you all the shipping details 
in your name and the tracking numbers that will enable you monitor the 
movement of the shipment.

My company is not going to pay you upfront for the test barrels but it 
will be paid for after the contract agreement is signed between you and 
the CEO of the company, then you will be paid 60% upfront for bulk 
supply. The producer will sell to you at $9000 per barrel while my 
company buys at $22,400 per barrel. My job as your insider and your 
silent partner is to ensure that your company wins the bid. I cant move 
ahead with you without signing MOU, its the only agreement i have with 
you and its going to bind my 20% commission. So if you must move with me 
send to me your name in full, company name and full contact details for 
the drafting of MOU.

Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a very interesting process! I'm curious, how long does the testing phase usually take? And what exactly are you testing for in these barrels?

Also, could you please clarify the role of the producer in this scenario? Are they separate from my company or are we considered the producers in this case?

I appreciate your help and look forward to learning more about this opportunity.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

The test is to ascertain the correctness of the product and if it 
matches with the product specification. It will be tested just once. My 
company sees you as the producer and on no account should you allow them 
know the producer in Turkey, if they do they will go direct and even buy 
cheaper. The test will last for few hours and its being conducted in the 
lab and it will be supervised by me and conducted by my boys. The role 
of the producer is your business partner, he doesn't have any business 
with my company. When you pay him, he produces for you and ship to the 
address you gave to him but with your name as the sender and the name of 
our CPO as the receiver.

Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's fascinating to learn about the testing process and how it works. I understand the importance of keeping the producer's identity confidential.

I'm curious, what kind of tests will be conducted on the product? And how can we ensure that the quality remains consistent throughout?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

The same producer was producing for my late supplier for 6 years . All 
my company company wants to ascertain is the first 2 barrels. The 
product is a raw material, it not a finished product. Its tested just 
once and after it you will be given a supply contract agreement for 3 
years.  Send your name in full, company name and full contact address 
for the drafting of MOU.


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for reaching out and providing such detailed information. It's interesting to hear about the raw material production process. I'm curious, what kind of raw materials are we talking about here? And how does the testing process work?

I'm also intrigued by the mention of a supply contract agreement for years. Could you please elaborate more on this? What would be the terms and conditions of such an agreement?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

The name of the raw material is Elogrovinox E Herbal Solution which i 
have pronounced in one of my emails to you, its a bio herbal and  
unfinished product that my company uses for the production of so many 
life saving medication. The test is usually conducted at the lab to 
ascertain the correctness and its being done once when you supply the 
test barrels or samples. It is after the confirmatory test that my 
company sends you by email a 3 years supply contract agreement to sign 
and return. As soon as its returned you will be paid for the samples and 
you will also be paid 60% upfront to commence on your monthly bulk 
supply.


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's fascinating to learn about the Herbal Solution and its importance in producing life-saving products. I'm curious, what kind of tests are conducted on the samples? And how long does it usually take for the test results to come back?

Also, could you please elaborate more on the supply contract agreement? What are some of the key terms and conditions that I should be aware of?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

The supply contract agreement is usually for three years which is also 
subject to renewal after expiration. When is issued to you , you will 
read carefully , sign and return. Meanwhile is not in my place to issue 
supply contract agreement, it between the seller and the CEO of the 
company. The test does not take time, its just a day test. I told you 
before.


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your response. It's interesting to know that the supply contract agreement is usually for three years and subject to renewal. I'm curious, what factors determine whether or not the contract gets renewed? Also, could you please elaborate more on the day test? What does it involve?

I understand that issuing the supply contract agreement is not in your place but between the seller and the CEO of the company. However, could you possibly provide me with a general idea of what such an agreement might entail?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

I have explained this over and over again.The contract agreement is 
between the seller and the CEO of the company, the Seller means the 
supplier whom the contract is issued to. The contract is to authenticate 
the agreement between the supplier and the company. The renewal depends 
on you if you would want to continue or not. Our last supplier had the 
contract for 6 years before his demise. It was first given for 3 years 
and ennewed on expiration. The criterial is good product and its only 
the producer in Turkey that can give you that good product. At this 
juncture, i have touched every area of this business. During the 
processing i will be guiding you accordingly.


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's really helpful to understand the contract agreement better. I'm curious, how does the renewal process work? And what are the specific criteria for a good product? 

Also, could you tell me more about the producer in Turkey? What makes their product so unique?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:

Like i said, when the we commence on the process i will guide you 
accordingly. Send your details for MOU drafting.


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:

Thank you for your message. I'm really excited about this process and can't wait to get started! Could you please provide me with more information about what the MOU drafting entails? What kind of details are needed for this?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

Send your name in full, company name and full contact address for the 
drafting of MOU. When i send you will read carefully before signing by 
so doing you will ascertain what it intails,


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Martin,

Thank you for your message. I'm really interested in learning more about this MOU and what it entails. Could you please provide me with some more details? What is the purpose of this MOU? And how will it benefit both parties involved?

I'm sorry, but I can't provide my full name, company name, or contact address at this time. Is there any other way we can proceed without sharing these details?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Michael

subject: Re: Hello,
body:
Hello Michael,

The MOU is the agreement between both of us and the purpose is to bind 
our profit sharing but if you can not provide your information there is 
no point moving forward. All i want in this business is a transparent 
person. In one of my emails to you i told you about my commission which 
is 20% from the total profit you are making from each barrels you sold 
to my company. My work is to provide you with the basic information and 
directives and ensuring that you win the supply contract bid. If you 
insist in not releasing your information for MOU, dont bother replying 
this email.


Martin Klonz

subject: Re: Hello,
body:

Thank you for your email and for explaining the purpose of the MOU. I understand that it's important to have a clear agreement in place before we proceed with any business dealings.

I'm interested in learning more about how this profit sharing would work. Could you provide some more details? For example, how is the total profit calculated? And what percentage would be my commission?

Also, could you explain a bit more about the supply contract bid? How does that process work?

I appreciate your patience as I try to understand all of this. Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Michael
